instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1990: What is A1990? A1990 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2018, 2019 with EMC3215, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01041, 820-01814..
definitions.820-01041: What is 820-01041? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP5V_G3S: What is PP5V_G3S? PP5V_G3S is a 5v power rail present when the system is in a G3S standby state.
definitions.PP1V8_SLPS2R: What is PP1V8_SLPS2R? PP1V8_SLPS2R is a 1.8v power rail present when the system is in a SLPS2R state. .
definitions.PP1V1_SLPS2R: What is PP1V1_SLPS2R? The PP1V1_SLPS2R power rail in the MacBook schematic provides a 1.1-volt supply in a specific low-power state indicated by the "_SLPS2R" suffix and is used for powering the T2 chip..
definitions.P5VG3S_EN: What is P5VG3S_EN? This signal enables the PP5V_G3S power rail when it is high. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .
definitions.ISL9240: What is ISL9240? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2018 through 2020.
definitions.I2C_PWR_SDA: What is I2C_PWR_SDA? I2C_PWR_SDA is the SMBUS data line between the system management controller(SMC), battery, ISL9240 battery charging chip, and power management unit(PMU). This line is necessary for the machine to communicate with the battery, see the battery, and use the battery. When this line is malfunctioning or shorted to ground, the machine will have an X icon over the battery and not run off the battery. .
definitions.I2C_PWR_SCL: What is I2C_PWR_SCL? I2C_PWR_SCL is the clock line of the SMBUS data line between the system management controller(SMC), battery, ISL9240 battery charging chip, and power management unit(PMU). This line is necessary for the machine to communicate with the battery, see the battery, and use the battery. When this line is malfunctioning or shorted to ground, the machine will have an X icon over the battery and not run off the battery. .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-07) - <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 12.23V
threads.message:
Hi,

i have here a „<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-07“ with <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> on 12.23V.

When I connect it to the charger (just the logicboard / without battery) I’m getting 19.6V / 0.00-0.05A (it’s power cycling).

Already tried a DFU restore via AC2, sadly it ends with an error. (T2 is getting warm during DFU restore)

Shouldn’t be <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> at 12.6V? So it’s too low if you ask me.

Edit: L9080/L9081 (PIN1/2) diode values are 0.350V, when I plug in the power cable the values are going down to 0.060V. Dead SSD? If yes, is it possible to replace a faulty NAND?

Edit2:

<SIGNAL>PP5V_G3S</SIGNAL> = 0V
<SIGNAL>P5VG3S_EN</SIGNAL> = 0V
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL> = 1.8V
<SIGNAL>PP1V0_SLPS2R</SIGNAL> = 0.8V
<SIGNAL>PP1V1_SLPS2R</SIGNAL> = 1.1V
<SIGNAL>PPVDDCPU_AWAKE</SIGNAL> = 0.75V
<SIGNAL>PP0V82_SLPDDR</SIGNAL> = 0.82V

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-07) - <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 12.23V
threads.message:
"L9080/L9081 (PIN1/2) diode values are 0.350V, when I plug in the power cable the values are going down to 0.060V"
Are you checking diode mode with power applied???
In fact, allow 10-15s after power is removed, before checking in diode mode, or ohm scale.

Incorrect <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is caused by incorrect communication between T2 and <CHIP>ISL9240</CHIP>.
The voltage can be corrected by DFU sometimes, if no hardware problems on the MLB.
You should check first diode mode and voltage on battery's SCL/SDA lines.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-07) - <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 12.23V
threads.message:
Sry my fault .... Ignore that.

<SIGNAL>I2C_BATT_SCL_R</SIGNAL> = 1.8V / 0.456
<SIGNAL>I2C_PWR_SDA</SIGNAL> = 1.8V / 0.455

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-07) - <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 12.23V
threads.message:
Did you check without battery connected?
If yes, check removing <CHIP>U6950</CHIP> too.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-07) - <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 12.23V

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-07) - <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 12.23V
threads.message:
Did you try both revive/restore options?
If yes, reflash SoC ROM and try DFU again.
Don't forget to make backup first...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-07) - <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 12.23V
threads.message:
I have successfully flashed the .BIN file to the SoC ROM.

Now im getting the following message in AC2
Unexpected device state 'DFU' expected 'Recovery' (Probably forced into DFU mode externally) [com.apple.MobileDevice.MobileRestore – 0xFAE (4014)]

Note: 
<SIGNAL>SOC_FORCE_DFU</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL> are not connected.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-07) - <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 12.23V
threads.message: Force it off with power button and try to start in DFU again.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-07) - <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 12.23V
threads.message:
Already tried that but sadly its entering DFU again and restore always ends with the message above.

The ".BIN" should work, right? Or is there anything I missed? Before the reflashing it wasn't 24/7 in DFU.

Edit: Also strange is that when the MB is assembled it stays on "4.97V/0.00-0.01A". After I connect my MB (with AC2 and left port close to the trackpad) it goes up to "19.7V/0.06A" and shows up in AC2.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-07) - <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 12.23V
threads.message:
The dump is good.
Is normal to enter in recovery by itself, once SoC ROM has been altered.
You can try now writing back original dump.

You may have problems with T2, or SSD.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-07) - <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 12.23V
threads.message:
I don’t have a good board :/ Regarding to the “wiki” it says that “Error 4014” means bad T2 RAM or battery.

In case the RAM is bad, can it be replaced by a good one? So is the RAM serialized with T2 CPU? (CPU and RAM are “sandwiched” right?)

[URL unfurl="true"]https://logi.wiki/index.php/DFU_Mode_Restore_(Macs)[/URL]

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-07) - <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 12.23V
threads.message:
Dealing with such sandwich chip is a nightmare.
Just watch this:
[MEDIA=youtube]<SIGNAL>ZCYHY_9XY7E</SIGNAL>[/MEDIA]
I didn't hear anybody changed only upper layer; there is T2 RAM located.
Some kind of "mariage" has been done by Apple, for sure.

Issue: When I press to hard on the stencil it moves etc. and also the heat kinda "deforms" it.

(Stencil: [URL]https://de.aliexpress.com/item/1005003583643579.html?spm=a2g0o.productlist.main.1.19826218QX85NB&algo_pvid=49734f2c-6bb2-42fe-be02-353df816d3bb&algo_exp_id=49734f2c-6bb2-42fe-be02-353df816d3bb-0&pdp_npi=3%40dis%21EUR%214.96%214.96%21%21%21%21%21%40210218bf16837488835526099d0743%2112000026375700186%21sea%21DE%212089647285&curPageLogUid=DGeBOcZ3wRIF[/URL])
